page.title: 09Tiddington
page.content: Tiddington is the largest village in the sector.Like Shabbington,it has an old church still in use,where two family names are prominent in the graveyard-Maule,and Ilbery.The Ilberys live at North Weston,and Tiddington. There is a caravan sales centre, a garage, and a pub,on the A418,and a small post office off the main road. The road is heavily used and has no crossing-there is a dangerous bend as you enter the village from Thame.The homes on the A418 are mostly old,of stone or brick with chimneys.Some are thatched-one thatchers mark was a bird. On the Ickford road are newer homes and bungalows.We think that the heavy traffic must make life restricting for old or handicapped people and children, and you need a car to live there since there are so few buses and shops.There are no schools-pupils must travel.
